items.body:
...correct? Borked? Hard to say. 

But this is true: (sine old fb x) - (sin new fb 2 x) = 0
Or in other words the new one gives exactly the same result as the old at half the percent value. 

In FM2 and 3 this is not true. The new and old modes never subtract to silence. 

Investigation needed.

items.title: Add Tone Circle to Radial

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

labels.name: UI
labels.description: Issues related to UI look&feel

labels.name: Tuning
labels.description: Non-standard tuning extensions

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
Scala and Entonal offer a Radial Dial where the notes appear at their distance from each other whereas Surge's radial has notes equally apart based on the number of notes per scale while showing their deviation from equal. As per a discussion on Discord there was interest in having this Scale Tone circle feature added to Surge.

Currently the Radial dial in Surge appears as follows 

![Screenshot_20230808_211100](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/41337033/b33129ae-415e-45e3-8b51-7c119460a05b)

For the same tuning, Scala offers this variation:
![Screenshot_20230808_211001](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/41337033/1652c36a-2916-4ee5-aee6-118fcee38b31)

Same tuning for Entonal displays with this style:
![Screenshot_20230808_211213](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/41337033/26d0c713-5f10-43d4-9986-2e84bd4eff40)

The tuning for reference:

```
! 17 Tone 5 5ths down 4/3 generator.scl
!
17 Tone 5 5ths down 4/3 generator
 17
!
 256/243
 65536/59049
 9/8
 32/27
 8192/6561
 81/64
 4/3
 1024/729
 262144/177147
 3/2
 128/81
 32768/19683
 27/16
 16/9
 4096/2187
 243/128
 2/1
 ```
 
As for the display, having both the fractions (or cents) for the notes (as per Entonal) as well as the distance between the notes in cents (as per Scala) would be ideal.

items.title: Tuning Editor functionality in MTS Client Mode

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

labels.name: Tuning
labels.description: Non-standard tuning extensions

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
Currently if Surge is in MTS-ESP client mode the Tuning Editor is dormant and not reading data

The request is to have Radial and True Keys provide scale information as it would if Surge was playing from a loaded .scl file

As per our discussion on Discord:

True Keys display would require:

1: The currently pressed keys
2: Their frequency
3: The ability to subtract and take a log 

*Since we show actual keys not scale tones. We have all of that in MTS mode

The Radial display would require:

1: The currently pressed key
2: The scale tone for each of those keys
3: The repetition interval of the scale
4: Their frequency
5: The ability to subtract and take a log

*We are missing 2 and 3 in the MTS api but have it in the tuning library

If it's possible it would be great if you could control all the step sequencer from the track envelopes to give more dynamics to the sequence.
Thank you!

labels.name: Bug Report

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
Surge window will start to corrupt graphics by rendering almost everything black, until all the monitors are black.

**Surge XT Version**
Latest debian package version.

**Reproduction Steps:**
1. Just open the program, it completely breaks the whole OS rendering until you close it.

**Expected Behavior:**
To not bug out rendering.

**Screenshots:**
None

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Linux Mint
 - Host: None
 - Version: Latest

**Additional Information:**
nvidia-driver-525
Geforce GTX 750 Ti
Geforce GTX 1050 Ti

I'm pretty sure no other programs, including games break rendering like this so I wouldn't have a clue why surge does this.

items.title: Handle latch in dual MPE and no-23 mode
items.body:
In MPE or ignore-23-to-scene mode, turning one scene on to latch would mistakenly trigger voices in the non latched scene. Fix that but adding an intended scene optional argument to playNote and calling it from the right place. Also add a regtest.

Closes #6963

items.title: Plaits Firmware Update released

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

labels.name: Oscillator
labels.description: Features or additions to the oscillator section

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.x
milestone.description: Things we could do in the 1.x family but didn't make 1.2 or 1.3

items.body:
Over at https://github.com/pichenettes/eurorack/blob/master/plaits/dsp/voice.cc you can see that mutable has released the firmware for the expanded plaits modes. We can and should integrate this with surge. A few tricks, though

1. Gotta update that submodule fork to the new code. Easy
2. Patch compatibility is mildly tricky since the engine orders change. So up the streaming version when we make this change and go ahead and do an unstream handler
3. Rack is also a bit tricky since it needs a separate unstream handler, so remember to do that
4. Fix the engine UI things
5. Most importantly, you can have user wavetables and FM models. Think about if or how we support that. (In theory twist could support a 'wavetable' which is the sysex for the models. but requires thought.

Dont know if we do this for 1.3, so putting here in 1.3 for now so I can stare at it and remove it from the milestone towards the end, to be honest.

items.title: Osc noteid fix
items.body: Fixed faulty data items check on /patch and /tuning messages. String arguments can't be counted reliably, and don't need to be.

items.title: Osc noteid fix
Osc noteid fix
items.body: Added capability of user-supplied noteIDs, to support finer-grained modulation of notes (future enhancement). If you can, please check the OSC spec. HTML page (accessed from the OSC Settings menu), as much had to be changed to accommodate the complexity of Note options.

items.title: SF2 oscillator type

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

items.body:
Would it be feasible to add soundfont SF2 as an oscillator type into Surge XT ?

Since discovering Swami Project ( http://www.swamiproject.org/ )  on my linux system, having lots of fun creating my own soundfonts & playing with existing soundfonts.
Although maybe dated, the open soundfont format is  very powerfull, almost endless possibilities for making professional sounds & presets from short wav files into a single sf2 file ! 
Wav files can be looped, played once, layered ect, would be super to be able to combine this with surge XT's synth features.

Thank you Surge team for all superb instruments !

items.title: CLI OpenSoundControl works
items.body: The CLI has a separate process loop so it needs to make sure to call processBlockOSC().

items.title: Osc freqnote
shared_ptr<float[N]> workaround
items.body:
C++17 allows a `shared_ptr<float[N]>` but earlier doesn't. Thats fine we are C++17 but rack compiles with such an old version of the OSX SDK that it doesn't have the appropriat econstructor in place. We could do a bunch of ifdefs to fix this but instead, just make the type `shared_ptr<float>` in this case and adjust the constructor to have a custom [] deallocator.

Addresses #7116
Addresses https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge-rack/issues/904

items.title: Surge Is not available to ProTools on Mac

Hi I hope you can assist, I have had Surge XT installed on my Mac (version 12.4 Monterey) for quite some time now see below for version info

My problem is it does not appear in my Protools (version 2023.6) track inserts options so I cannot use it and I'm eager to get going with it, it looks great on the surface but I want to hear it and do things with it

I have version: Surge XT 1.0.1.60228e8
Build: 2022-01-31 @ 16:53:52 on 'Mac-1643647381380.local/pipeline' with 'AppleClang-12.0.0.12000032' using JUCE 6.1.2
System: macOS 64-bit Standalone on Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-6500 CPU @ 3.20GHz
Sample Rate: 44.1 kHz

Maybe it is superseded but I do remember running the installer and it showed no errors

Your guidance is much appreciated

Feel free to drop a mail to bhudders@gmail.com preferably

Best regards
Brian Hudson

labels.description: Issues pertaining to Surge standalone application and CLI (command line interface)

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
With https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/commit/1c86f31caffdd8f57a29e240db263ecbd233e3e0 we introduced surge-xt-CLI. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GqATdng9y9A

So what's to be done still?

- [x] Include it in installer
    - [x] zip file all platforms
    - [x] macos embedded in standalone
    - [x] deb
    - [x] rpm
    - [x] win64 maybe? maybe not?
- [x] sample rate, buffer size as arguments
- [x] use default audio device if nothing specified 
- [x] consistency check on command line arguments
- [x] bind all midi option
- [x] stopping condition 
- [x] output channel (right now on device we bind to output 0,1 only - that's the nasty bitset
- [x] inputs? Do we want to bother
- [x] add to manual

comments below as we go. thanks

Right now it doesn't do much. This commit is to put the plumbing in place and frankly make sure it builds in CI!

2. Move float_to_clocalestr to UnitConversions

items.title: Cleanup locale spread

labels.name: Code Refactoring
labels.description: General code refactoring and cleanup issues like names, unused variables, warnings, fixme

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
Over time the code has 3 ways to deal with locale

1. set `::locale` globaly and printf. UnitConversions.h. Bad. Global and not thread safe
2. `std::imbue` a `std::ostream`. Medium. Local and thread safe but old threads API. Grep for std::imbue
3. `fmt::format(std::locale::classic(), "{:L}", value);`. What we want

Moreover, we don't have a regtest to stream and unstream a patch in a non-standard charset. May be tricky to write.

But anyway just a reminder to clean this up some as it popped up doing OSC.

items.title: Osc enhance
items.body: Added OSC output and many new messages are understood and sent.

items.title: Menu Bold Fonts use the Bold Typeface
items.body:
Bold fonts in menus used `getPopupMenuFont().bolden()` which in some cases on macOS renders improperly for our TTF font but we aren't sure why. We already ship the LatoBold font TTF with surge, so instead add a `getPopupMenuFontBold` API point which uses that TTF and adjust calling code to use that rather than font.bolden

My theory is this will address #7021 but lets leave it open until we get confirmation from a user.

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

When attempting to change patchesr using keybinds after a patch has been modified, there is no indication that the dialog has appeared. Of course, it has, and it is usable, but it no longer jumps keyboard focus as it once did.

**Surge XT Version**
This information is found on the About screen, which you get to from the bottom right menu.

Surge XT 1.3.nightly.5628124

* Version:
* Plugin Type: [VST2, VST3, AU]
VST, CLAP
* Bitness: [32-bit or 64-bit]

64-bit

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Modify an existing patch
2. Try to change patch categories or patch in category using the keybinds
3. Note that the keyboard focus does not jump to the dialog asking if it's OK to overwrite

**Expected Behavior:**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

Keyboard focus should jump to the dialog

**Screenshots:**
If applicable, add screenshots/GIF/videos to help explain your problem.

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: [e.g. Windows 10]

Windows 11

 - Host: [e.g. Bitwig, Logic, Cubase, Reaper]
Reaper
 - Version: [e.g. 2.4]

6.80

**Additional Information:**
Add any other context about the problem here.

From Discord:

Oh we changed all those dialogs. I wonder if I’m doing so we didn’t port the keyboard focus behavior of the alert box @EvilDragon

items.title: Rename Combinator modes to mystery box
items.body: Also a break; was missing so Bonsai routing options were bleeding through the RM volume parameter's context menu

items.title: Upgrade sst-effects for Flanger; Nimbus enum public
items.body:
1. sst-effects has a tiney flanger fix; pull the submodule
2. Nimbus slot enum was private; make it public for rack

Closes #7083

items.title: FX Swap in Undo; Swap to Self crash resolved
items.body:
1. FX Swap didn't particpate in Undo. It does now (with a full patch stream which is the best we can do)

2. FX Swap when dropped on itself would swap with self, with sometimes catastrophic mistakes. Put a source==target guard in along with the other source and target range checks. Closes #7085

items.title: Crash when left-click, drag & holding Mojo FX and dropping onto itself on a certain preset.

labels.name: UX
labels.description: Issues related to user experience (UX) - mouse, touch, keyboard, MIDI inputs, etc.

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
Dropping the Mojo FX onto itself will cause Reaper to crash when on a specific preset.

**Surge XT Version**
This information is found on the About screen, which you get to from the bottom right menu.

* Version: 1.2.0.cb11acd
* Plugin Type: VST3
* Bitness: 64-bit

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. 1st select the 'Slowboat > Rhythms > Bellish Shape Shimmer' preset from the 3rd party section.
2. Look for the Airwindows Mojo FX on the Global FX 2 slot at the end.
3. Left-click, drag and move the FX box slightly, and then release so it drops onto the same spot (onto itself).
4. Reaper will then crash.

**Expected Behavior:**
There should be no change to the FX or slot when dropping onto itself, and there usually isn't.

**Screenshots:**
N/A.

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Windows 10 Home
 - Host: Reaper
 - Version: 6.80

**Additional Information:**
This doesn't happen on the initial patch.

labels.name: DSP
labels.description: Issues and feature requests related to sound generation in the synth

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
```
diff --git a/src/common/CMakeLists.txt b/src/common/CMakeLists.txt
index 1996fc19..196df2ee 100644
--- a/src/common/CMakeLists.txt
+++ b/src/common/CMakeLists.txt
@@ -317,6 +317,7 @@ elseif(UNIX)
     target_link_libraries(${PROJECT_NAME} PRIVATE execinfo)
   endif()
   target_link_libraries(${PROJECT_NAME} PUBLIC surge::simde)
+  target_compile_options(${PROJECT_NAME} PUBLIC $<$<CXX_COMPILER_ID:GNU>:-Werror=restrict>)
 elseif(WIN32)
   target_compile_definitions(${PROJECT_NAME} PUBLIC
     WINDOWS=1
```

will make bonsai fail to build on gcc with a thousand errors and Chorus with one

We need to be careful either removing restrict or having in-place versions of operations.

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
Unable to open Audio/MIDI Settings window in standalone app (JUCE issue?)

**Surge XT Version**
1.0.0 -> 1.2.3

* Version:
Standalone

**Reproduction Steps:**
1. Click "Options"
2. Click "Audio/MIDI Settings..."
3. The Settings window doesn't show up.

**Expected Behavior:**
Settings window shows up

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Ubuntu 23.04
 - Host: Standalone

**Additional Information:**
The setting window shows up when the app is launched in XNest without any WM.

items.title: ] key and new vkb

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

labels.name: Accessibility
labels.description: Issues related to making Surge more accessible

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
With the new vkb we bind `]` to extended keyboard but that key is also accessible key for menu open so right now any action with accessible on that opens a menu also plays a key. So

1. why? Why doesn’t the event get eaten and why does it go to the vkb. Is it keypress vs scan keybed
2. If we can’t answer that de extend the keyboard if the key edits are on and
3. If we can’t do a that make a narrow vkb binding which activates when key edits are on 

or some such. But gotta sort it out!

items.title: Migrate message boxes to new UI
items.body:
Closes #5663.

Previous: 
![Current message box](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/5881947/22927a1c-84e1-49fa-860d-1f196220c8dc)

New: 
![message box new](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/5881947/8b5c8923-2a62-460e-8c9d-a85bacbb7fda)

Question: Unless I'm missing something, exactly one message box remains: https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/blob/21baada63f332f62b32df3ac2c794b3250e221b8/src/surge-fx/SurgeFXEditor.cpp#L598 
Since it's in surge-fx, I'll have to link the surge-xt project in the surge-fx makefile to use the work we've done so far? That seems like overkill for this, is there something I'm missing?

items.title: Memory junk displayed in modulation hover text

labels.name: UI
labels.description: Issues related to UI look&feel

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
When I modulate a DLY FX parameter, I see random memory rendered in the bottom line of the hover text.
Patch attached.
[Handbells Dev 2.005.fxp.zip](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/files/11848511/Handbells.Dev.2.005.fxp.zip)


**Surge XT Version**
Version: Surge XT 1.3.nightly.605b717
Build: 2023-06-05 @ 22:22:33 on 'WIN-9J4PM7PJGLL/pipeline' with 'MSVC-19.29.30148.0' using JUCE 7.0.5
System: Windows 64-bit VST3 on Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-7700HQ CPU @ 2.80GHz
Host: Cakewalk by Bandlab @ 44.1 kHz / Process block size: 32 samples


**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. While editing Scene B [might not be relevant], create a delay in FX slot G2.
2. Arm a macro.
3. Modulate the Mix [or any] parameter of created DLY.

![image](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/13245475/a8220324-293d-4608-942d-6d784fbcbe56)

When you click on the slider to modulate, the hover text shows memory junk, where I expect to see the possible range of the applied modulation.

**Expected Behavior:**
I expect to see the possible range of the applied modulation.

**Screenshots:**
![image](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/13245475/f239bebb-8915-4596-bc75-0c9beee865ce)

**Additional Information:**
Likely a mistyped variable, bad pointer, or old string, where the text is composed?

items.title: Building Cardinal on Arch Linux fails with an error pointing to Surge

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
When I try building Cardinal with all the submodules pulled on Arch Linux, the building process fails with an error pointing to Surge.

**Surge XT Version**
Commit a1601da407db331a39b337b213ed0a66e196262c

**Reproduction Steps:**
Run the following commands from the terminal:

```
git clone --depth=1 https://github.com/DISTRHO/Cardinal
cd Cardinal
git submodule update --init --recursive
make
```

**Expected Behavior:**
Cardinal compiles.

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Arch Linux
 - GCC version: 13.1.1 20230429
 - Host: -
 - Version: -

**Additional Information:**
Here's the error:

```
In file included from /media/pici/Cardinal/plugins/surgext/surge/src/common/SkinColors.cpp:1:
/media/pici/Cardinal/plugins/surgext/surge/src/common/SkinColors.h:22:36: error: ‘uint32_t’ has not been declared
   22 |     Color(const std::string &name, uint32_t argb);
      |                                    ^~~~~~~~
/media/pici/Cardinal/plugins/surgext/surge/src/common/SkinColors.h:23:36: error: ‘uint32_t’ has not been declared
   23 |     Color(const std::string &name, uint32_t rgb, char alpha);
      |                                    ^~~~~~~~
/media/pici/Cardinal/plugins/surgext/surge/src/common/SkinColors.h:29:5: error: ‘uint8_t’ does not name a type
   29 |     uint8_t r, g, b, a;
      |     ^~~~~~~
/media/pici/Cardinal/plugins/surgext/surge/src/common/SkinColors.h:5:1: note: ‘uint8_t’ is defined in header ‘<cstdint>’; did you forget to ‘#include <cstdint>’?
    4 | #include <vector>
  +++ |+#include <cstdint>
    5 |
make[5]: *** [src/common/CMakeFiles/surge-common.dir/build.make:174: src/common/CMakeFiles/surge-common.dir/SkinColors.cpp.o] Error 1
make[5]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
make[5]: Leaving directory '/media/pici/Cardinal/deps/surge-build'
make[4]: *** [CMakeFiles/Makefile2:782: src/common/CMakeFiles/surge-common.dir/all] Error 2
make[4]: Leaving directory '/media/pici/Cardinal/deps/surge-build'
make[3]: *** [CMakeFiles/Makefile2:789: src/common/CMakeFiles/surge-common.dir/rule] Error 2
make[3]: Leaving directory '/media/pici/Cardinal/deps/surge-build'
make[2]: *** [Makefile:332: surge-common] Error 2
make[2]: Leaving directory '/media/pici/Cardinal/deps/surge-build'
make[1]: *** [Makefile:299: /media/pici/Cardinal/deps/surge-build/src/common/libsurge-common.a] Error 2
make[1]: Leaving directory '/media/pici/Cardinal/deps'
make: *** [Makefile:176: deps] Error 2
```

items.body: Fixes #6551

items.title: OSC improvements: patch loading, OSC output (path of loaded patch)
items.body:
Enhancements to OSC:

Patch changing via OSC is working, including full path specification, patch incr/decr, category incr/decr, and random patch change.

OSC output has been added. The first (and only, so far) message reports the path for patch changes.

All patch and tuning file paths have been made consistent in excluding file extension from OSC messages. They are added contextually in OSCListener.
